intro: Omalocline montana, commonly known as the mountain omalocline, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to high-altitude regions of the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, fern-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are white to pale yellow and are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Omalocline montana thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, mountainous climates.
